str2: Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
A mother-in-law. Feminine of pentheros; a wife's mother.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and keimai; to lie down, i.e. be sick; specially, to recline at a meal.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To be sick with a fever. From pura; to be on fire, i.e., to have a fever.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
